tour.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc
tour.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We met on a coach tour in Italy.
tour.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a short trip through a place to see it
tour.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Kim worked as a tour guide in Cambridge last summer.
a guided tour around the Kennedy Space Center
tour.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a planned journey made by musicians, a sports team etc in order to perform or play in several places
tour.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: the first leg of the band’s European tour (=the first part of it)
the England cricket team’s tour of India
The Moscow Symphony Orchestra is here on tour.
tour.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a period during which you go to live somewhere, usually abroad, to do your job, especially military work
tour.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: his third tour in Northern Ireland
tour.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to visit several parts of a country or area
tour.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: We’re touring the Greek islands this summer.
tour.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to go round or be shown round a place
tour.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The minister had been invited to tour the new factory.
